column2: GEORGIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Georgia
column6: GA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column6: Lane reduction - the right lane ends soon
column8: Lane reduction - the left lane ends soon

column2: 2. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.

column2: 3. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.

column2: 4. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 5. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column6: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column8: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.

column2: 6. This sign is a:
column4: warning sign.
column6: regulatory sign.

column2: 7. The yield sign means:
column4: Go. The light will soon be red.
column6: Stop if you can.
column8: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curve ahead
column6: Right turn permitted

column2: 9. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 10. Which signs have black letters on a white background?
column4: Guide signs (horizontal rectangle)
column6: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 11. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)
column6: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 12. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: they cannot go straight ahead.

column2: 13. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Parallel railroad crossing (side road)
column6: Low ground clearance railroad crossing

column2: 14. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: No U-turns
column6: No left turn

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Stop sign ahead
column6: Reduction in lanes

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 18. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: watch for this species crossing the road.
column6: park in the zoo area.
column8: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 19. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: obey signals from crossing guards.
column6: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 20. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: hill
column6: soft shoulder

column2: 21. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 22. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 23. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.

column2: 24. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column8: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

column2: 25. If it becomes necessary to stop on the expressway, you should:
column4: get out of the car to warn others that you have stopped.
column6: walk along the expressway in search of help.
column8: raise the hood and activate your hazard lights to indicate difficulty.

column2: 26. BAC is expressed in:
column4: percentage of alcohol to blood.
column6: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 27. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 28. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 29. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column6: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 30. When approaching an intersection with a traffic control signal that is not working, drivers should:
column4: stop as you would if there were stop signs in all directions, yield the right-of-way, then enter the intersection.
column6: speed up and proceed through the intersection.
column8: try not to stop if the intersection is clear.

column2: 31. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 32. When passing a motorcycle you must:
column4: give the motorcyclist the entire traffic lane as if the motorcycle was a car.
column6: sound your horn to alert the motorcyclist.
column8: give the motorcyclist the right hand part of his traffic lane.

column2: 33. Arrows on the roadway:
column4: indicate HOV lanes.
column6: show which lanes you must use.

column2: 34. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column4: is a good defensive driving technique.
column6: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 35. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 36. You ________ traffic headed toward you when you turn left.
column4: must interrupt
column6: must yield to

column2: 37. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 38. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column4: 0.08% or more.
column6: any amount.

column2: 39. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Get enough sleep.

column2: 40. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
